title: What It’s Like to Take Part in Journeys? Experiences From Our Last Demo Day
content: What It’s Like to Take Part in Journeys? Experiences From Our Last Demo Day lisvilar@helsinki.fi Tue, 27/01/2026 - 14:31 The call for Journeys, our University of Helsinki incubator programme, is still open for a few more days. Applications are arriving, steadily. And while the team reads each one, we look back thinking about the people who, only a few months ago, stood exactly where these new applicants now will stand. Last month, the previous cohort reached its final evening in Valkoinen Sali, ...

title: Krimo's Visiting Research Fellow programme open again
content: Krimo's Visiting Research Fellow programme open again ajraeste@helsinki.fi Tue, 27/01/2026 - 10:13 The application period for the fall semester ends on February 15. Krimo's application portal for visiting researchers is open once again! Krimo offers a unique intellectual environment for visitors who wish to engage with high level empirical research on issues of crime and criminal policy and legal policy. The deadlines are February 15  for the fall semester (starts in September), and Septemb...

title: New Nordic research collaboration  to reveal linked mechanisms of age-related fatty liver and muscle loss
content: New Nordic research collaboration to reveal linked mechanisms of age-related fatty liver and muscle loss etelamak@helsinki.fi Mon, 26/01/2026 - 16:10 A highly competitive award of over 2 million euros from the Novo Nordisk Foundation will support a new research collaboration focused on uncovering the shared metabolic mechanisms linking age-related liver disease and muscle loss. More than half of over 60-year-olds suffer from more than one chronic disease, reducing their independence and quality ...

title: Markus Kröger annouced as keynote speaker at the VII International Congress on Risks
content: Markus Kröger annouced as keynote speaker at the VII International Congress on Risks albov@helsinki.fi Mon, 26/01/2026 - 12:02 The conference will take place from 26 to 29 of May 2026, at the Faculty of Arts and Humanities of the University of Coimbra in Portugal. content: Markus Kröger interview by the CEIS20 Podcast albov@helsinki.fi Mon, 26/01/2026 - 10:01 Markus was interviewed by the CEIS20 Podcast during a research visit to the Centre for Interdisciplinary Studies (CEIS20) at the University of Coimbra in Portugual. title: Helsingin yliopiston sijoitustuotto kuusi prosenttia vuonna 2025
content: University of Helsinki investment return six percent in 2025 ksalmiva@helsinki.fi Thu, 22/01/2026 - 15:14 The investments have returned more than 400 million Euros since 2019 University of Helsinki’s financial security investments returned 6.0 percent in 2025. Since the beginning of 2019, when the University adopted the current strategy, the investments have returned cumulatively 116.9 percent, or approximately 440 million Euros. The average annual return has been 11.7 percent, which is 2.0 perc...

title: Helsingin yliopiston kasvatustieteet 41. THE Rankingissa
content: Educational sciences at the University of Helsinki 41st in THE World University Rankings taalto@helsinki.fi Thu, 22/01/2026 - 17:06 The educational sciences improved their ranking from 50 to 41 in the discipline-specific annual Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings. This marked rise is a very positive change after years of decline, bringing back educational sciences at the University of Helsinki to the global top 50. Among European universities the University is ranked 8th, behi...

title: Punamullan matka hautaan viesti vainajan identiteetistä
content: Ochre’s passage to graves reflects the identity of the deceased njniskan@helsinki.fi Tue, 27/01/2026 - 15:02 A recent study indicates that colour was not the only property of ochre relevant to people in the Stone Age. Roughly 5,500–6,000 years ago, the area comprising present-day Finland was inhabited by hunter-fisher-gatherers living in small village-like clusters. Travelling via waterways, these people established permanent fishing systems and, at times, even cleared forests for small-scale fa...
creator: njniskan@helsinki.fi

content: The Natural History Museum will be closed during the maintenance week johanemi@helsinki.fi Fri, 09/01/2026 - 14:10 The museum will be closed during the maintenance week, Mon–Fri, 12–16 January 2026. The doors will reopen on Saturday, 17 January. The Natural History Museum will be closed during the maintenance week, Mon–Fri, 12–16 January. title: Kotina metsä -näyttely tuo luonnonmetsän keskelle Helsinkiä
content: Forest Home – Exhibition brings a natural forest to the heart of Helsinki johanemi@helsinki.fi Fri, 30/05/2025 - 14:09 In Finland, natural forests have become a rarity – and for many, they remain unfamiliar. The Forest Home exhibition invites visitors to discover them through photography, video installations and scientific specimens. Forest Home is on display at the Natural History Museum until 5 April 2026. Photographic artists Ritva Kovalainen and Sanni Seppo explore the rich life of natural f...
